title: Trades on the Fida marketplace
description: Insurance policies are risk assessed and priced by an underwriting insurer. The insurance company agrees to take a lead position covering a percentage of the coverage required. The remaining is taken by the Fida community on a 'follow-on' basis i.e. accepting the same terms as the lead insurer. These opportunities are posted on Fida by Brokers on behalf of the insured.

title: Fractionalization and Tokenization of Insurance Contracts
description: The remaining amount is fractionalized, divided into small denominations represented by Fida Cards on the marketplace. Each Fida Card gets exactly the same premium (and takes the same liability) proportionately as the main lead insurer. Investors can buy as many Cards as desired (if available) until the policy limit is covered.

title: Smart Contracts & Securing the Funds
description: When the policy limit is attained the Fida Cards are minted. The funds are secured in a frozen 'time locked' smart contract and the policy goes 'on risk'. The smart contract determines the distribution of the premium to the Fida Card holders, the liability in the event of a claim for which the Fida Card holders are responsible and the designated parties responsible for authorizing the execution of the smart contract (typically the lead insurer) thus triggering the payout of a claim.

title: Premium & Investors Portfolio Premium Pools.
description: Premium payments are distributed from the insured to the holders of the Fida Cards proportionate to ownership. Premium is added to each Investor's Portfolio Premium Pool. Thus, for investors who have many Fida cards representing multiple different policies (a portfolio), the premium generated across all policies is used to pay any potential claims for any policy before the underlying collateral is used. This encourages investors create a diversified portfolio so the 'premiums of the many pay for the claims of a few'.

title: Claims
description: Claims are paid out when a specific qualifying event occurs (for parametric products) or when a valid claim has been approved by the official third party. Claims are paid proportionately to the risk exposure taken by the Lead Insurer and the Fida Card holders. Each Fida Cards pays proportionate to the exposure to the total liability. Claims payments are first taken from the Investors Portfolio Premium Pool. If the Premium Pool is exhausted claims are paid from the underlying collateral held in the policy smart contract.

title: End of Policy
description: At the end of the Policy Term, if no claim has been triggered each Fida Card holder has the collateral returned to them. If a claim has been triggered, but was paid out of the Investors Portfolio Premium Pool, then the Fida Card holder has the full capital of the underlying collateral returned to them i.e. face value of the Fida Card. If a claim has been triggered and underlying collateral was used, the Fida Card holder is paid the face value of the card minus any claim exposure of the card up to a maximum of 100% loss of the underlying capital.

title: Increase capital efficiency
description:
Investors with a suitably diversified portfolio can potentially increase their capital efficiency in two ways: 
 1) decrease collateralization requirements by leveraging collateral held across their portfolio by using the Fida protocol to demonstrate compliance with Solvency 2 regulations, 
 2) access the Fida Fund that will take a proportion of the risk (the top line) but take disproportionately less of the premium.

title: Increase returns
description: In addition to increasing capital efficiency investors can further increase their returns by putting the capital locked in the insurance smart contract to work by making it available to secure interest earning Defi protocols e.g. staking. Investors therefore earn a return from the premium generated and by participating in selected Defi protocols.

title: The secondary market
description: Investors can resell their Fida Cards (to liquidate the associated underlying assets) on the Fida marketplace.
